name: Roo.XTemplate
desc:
Provides a template that can have nested templates for loops or conditionals. The syntax is: 

var t = new Roo.XTemplate(
	'<select name="{name}">',
		'<tpl for="options"><option value="{value:trim}">{text:ellipsis(10)}</option></tpl>',
	'</select>'
);
 
// then append, applying the master template values
Supported features: Tags: 

      {a_variable} - output encoded.
      {a_variable.format:("Y-m-d")} - call a method on the variable
      {a_variable:raw} - unencoded output
      {a_variable:toFixed(1,2)} - Roo.util.Format."toFixed"
      {a_variable:this.method_on_template(...)} - call a method on the template object.
The tpl tag: 

        <tpl for="a_variable or condition.."></tpl>
        <tpl if="a_variable or condition"></tpl>
        <tpl exec="some javascript"></tpl>
        <tpl name="named_template"></tpl> (experimental)
  
        <tpl for="."></tpl> - just iterate the property..
        <tpl for=".."></tpl> - iterates with the parent (probably the template)

config.name: html
config.desc: The HTML fragment or an array of fragments to join("") or multiple arguments to join("")

config.name: url
config.desc:
The Url to load the template from. beware if you are loading from a url, the data may not be ready if you use it instantly..
                   it should be fixed so that template is observable...

methods.name: applySubTemplate

params.name: id
params.desc: of the template

params.name: values
params.desc: to apply to template

params.name: parent
params.desc: (normaly the instance of this object)

methods.name: compile
methods.desc:
compile the template

This is not recursive, so I'm not sure how nested templates are really going to be handled..

methods.name: insertFirst
methods.desc: Applies the supplied values to the template and inserts the new node(s) as the first child of el.

params.name: el
params.desc: The context element

params.name: values
params.desc: The template values. Can be an array if your params are numeric (i.e. {0}) or an object (i.e. {foo: 'bar'})

params.name: returnElement
params.desc: (optional) true to return a Roo.Element (defaults to undefined)

methods.name: overwrite
methods.desc: Applies the supplied values to the template and overwrites the content of el with the new node(s).

params.name: el
params.desc: The context element

params.name: values
params.desc: The template values. Can be an array if your params are numeric (i.e. {0}) or an object (i.e. {foo: 'bar'})

params.name: returnElement
params.desc: (optional) true to return a Roo.Element (defaults to undefined)

methods.name: insertBefore
methods.desc: Applies the supplied values to the template and inserts the new node(s) before el.

params.name: el
params.desc: The context element

params.name: values
params.desc: The template values. Can be an array if your params are numeric (i.e. {0}) or an object (i.e. {foo: 'bar'})

params.name: returnElement
params.desc: (optional) true to return a Roo.Element (defaults to undefined)

methods.name: applyTemplate
methods.desc: Returns an HTML fragment of this template with the specified values applied.

params.name: values
params.desc: The template values. Can be an array if your params are numeric (i.e. {0}) or an object (i.e. {foo: 'bar'})

methods.name: set
methods.desc: Sets the HTML used as the template and optionally compiles it.

params.name: compile
params.desc: (optional) True to compile the template (defaults to undefined)

methods.name: from
methods.desc: Creates a template from the passed element's value (display:none textarea, preferred) or innerHTML.

params.name: el
params.desc: A DOM element or its id

methods.name: insertAfter
methods.desc: Applies the supplied values to the template and inserts the new node(s) after el.

params.name: el
params.desc: The context element

params.name: values
params.desc: The template values. Can be an array if your params are numeric (i.e. {0}) or an object (i.e. {foo: 'bar'})

params.name: returnElement
params.desc: (optional) true to return a Roo.Element (defaults to undefined)

methods.name: append
methods.desc: Applies the supplied values to the template and appends the new node(s) to el.

params.name: el
params.desc: The context element

params.name: values
params.desc: The template values. Can be an array if your params are numeric (i.e. {0}) or an object (i.e. {foo: 'bar'})

params.name: returnElement
params.desc: (optional) true to return a Roo.Element (defaults to undefined)
